message.content:
cs.DC, cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.SI 

The paper deals with causality and fault-tolerance in distributed computing, which are core topics in the sub-category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). The paper also introduces a new framework for epistemic reasoning in fault-tolerant multi-agent systems, which falls under the sub-category of Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO). The paper uses concepts from artificial intelligence, such as multi-agent systems, which makes cs.AI another likely sub-category. The paper also deals with security and trust in distributed systems, which falls under the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper proposes a new communication structure, which can be seen as a form of network topology, and thus falls under the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
